item.title: A bill to provide authority for the Federal Government to purchase and insure certain types of troubled assets for the purposes of providing stability to and preventing disruption in the economy and financial system and protecting taxpayers, to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide incentives for energy production and conservation, to extend certain expiring provisions, to provide individual income tax relief, and for other purposes.

item.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 209 - 198 (Roll no. 96). (text: CR H1259)
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 209 - 198 (Roll no. 96).(text: CR H1259)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 215 - 195 (Roll no. 95). (consideration: CR H1271)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1014.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H1259-1272)
On motion to consider the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 215 - 192, 1 Present (Roll no. 94). (consideration: CR H1259-1262)

POINT OF ORDER - The Broun (GA) raised a point of order against the provisions of H.Res. 1014 because it violates the Congressional Budget Act. The Chair announced that the desposition of the point of order would be resolved by the question of consideration of H. Res. 1014. The House proceeded with 20 minutes of debate on the point of order at the end of which the Chair will put the question of consideration.
By direction of the Committee on Rules, Ms Castor called up H. Res. 1014 for its immediate consideration.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 192.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1424 with 2 hours of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-538, by Ms. Castor.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-538, by Ms. Castor.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1424) to amend section 712 of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, section 2705 of the Public Health Service Act, and section 9812 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to require equity in the provision of mental health and substance-related disorder benefits under group health plans.
Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 1424 (Paul Wellstone Mental Health and Addiction Equity Act of 2007).
Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 1424 (Paul Wellstone Mental Health and Addiction Equity Act of 2007).

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1424) to amend section 712 of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, section 2705 of the Public Health Service Act, and section 9812 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to require equity in the provision of mental health and substance-related disorder benefits under group health plans.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
